title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.81 - Voluntary interest arbitration
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 263.81 - Voluntary interest arbitration

State Regulations
(a) In
the event that an employer and a labor organization agree to submit any
unresolved issue in bargaining to interest arbitration, they may jointly
request the assistance of the board in providing for such arbitration by a
letter directed to the director of conciliation. (b) The written request shall be accompanied
by a copy of the submission. (c) An
arbitrator shall be designated pursuant to the selection process established by
the director of conciliation, which process will give the parties an
opportunity to participate in the selection of the arbitrator. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
263.81

Adopted

New

York State Register February 15, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 07, eff. 2/15/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
